tit.e: Senshuraku (the last day of a performance)
Senshuraku (the last day of a performance)
Senshuraku (the last day of a performance)

sen.j: 千秋楽（せんしゅうらく）は「千穐楽」、「千龝楽」などとも表記され、複数日にわたって同じ演目を行う興行において、「最終日」を指す業界用語。
sen.e: 千秋楽 (senshuraku) is also written as 千穐楽 or 千龝楽, and, being an industrial term, indicates the last day, when plays on the same program are performed repeatedly every day for two or more days.
千秋楽 (senshuraku) is also written as 千穐楽 or 千龝楽, and, being an industrial term, indicates the last day, when plays on the same program are performed repeatedly every day for two or more days.
千秋楽 (senshuraku) is also written as 千穐楽 or 千龝楽, and, being an industrial term, indicates the last day, when plays on the same program are performed repeatedly every day for two or more days.

sen.j: 縮めて「楽日」（らくび）や「楽」（らく）ともいわれる。
sen.e: Shorter Rakubi or raku is also used for the same meaning.
The term "rakubi" (or the shorter "raku") is also used for the same meaning.
The term "rakubi" (or the shorter "raku") is also used for the same meaning.

sen.j: 本来は江戸時代の歌舞伎や大相撲における用語・風習であった。
sen.e: Originally, this term was used in kabuki and grand sumo tournaments.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Originally, this term was used in kabuki and grand sumo tournaments.
Originally, this term and custom was used in kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors) and grand sumo (Japanese-style wrestling) tournaments.

sen.j: しかし、現在では広く演劇や興行一般で用いられている。
sen.e: However, now, it is used widely in the fields of entertainments in general, including theatrical performances.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Today, however, it is used widely in the fields of entertainment in general, including theatrical performances.
Today, however, it is used widely in the fields of entertainment in general, including theatrical performances.

sen.j: これにちなみ、千秋楽の前日、もしくは1つ前に行われる公演は「前楽」（まえらく、楽日の前の意）と呼ばれることがある。
sen.e: Related to this term, the day before senshuraku or the play performed before the last one is called maeraku (the day before rakubi).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Related to this term, the day before senshuraku or the play performed before the last one is called maeraku (the day before rakubi).
Related to this term, the day before senshuraku or the play performed before the last one is called maeraku (the day before rakubi).

sen.j: また、1つの演目で各地を巡業した場合、最後の公演地で行われる千秋楽の公演を、特に「大千秋楽」（おおせんしゅうらく、略して「大楽」（おおらく）とも）と呼ばれることがある。
sen.e: In addition, when plays on the same program are performed in various places on a tour, the plays that are performed at the site visited last are sometimes called osenshuraku or oraku (literally, a big senshuraku) particularly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Additionally, when plays on the same program are performed in various places on a tour, in particular the plays that are performed at the site visited last are sometimes called osenshuraku or oraku (literally, a big senshuraku).
Additionally, when a play on the same program is performed in various places on a tour, the play that is performed at the site visited last is sometimes called osenshuraku or oraku in particular.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 「千穐楽」など異体字での表記は「秋」の文字にある「火」を忌んだものである。
sen.e: The expressions using different characters, such as 千穐楽, are utilized because the 火 (fire) included in character 秋 is disliked.
The expressions using different characters, such as 千穐楽, are employed because the 火 (fire) included in character 秋 is disliked.
The expressions using different characters, such as 千穐楽, are employed because the 火 (fire) included in character 秋 is observed a taboo.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: これは、江戸時代の歌舞伎小屋は火事の際に類焼することが多かったためである。
sen.e: This is because Kabuki huts were often burnt down in a spreading fire in the Edo period.
This is because kabuki huts were often burned down in the spreading fires of the Edo period.
This is because kabuki huts were often burned down by catching fires during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 語源
sen.e: The origin of the term
The origin of the term
The origin of the term

sen.j: 千秋楽の語源は諸説あるが、次の説が一般的である。
sen.e: There exist many theories about the origin of the term of snshuraku, but the following are the most popular ones:
There are many theories about the origin of the term of seshuraku, but the following are the most popular ones:
There are many theories about the origin of the term of senshuraku, but the following are the most popular ones:
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 雅楽を演奏する際、1日の最後の曲には祝言の意味から必ず「千秋楽」を演奏したという古い風習
sen.e: It came from the ancient custom that, when gagaku (traditional court music) was played, "senshuraku" which suggested congratulations was played as the last number of a day,
It came from the ancient custom that, when gagaku (traditional court music) was played, "senshuraku," which suggested congratulations, was played as the last number of the day.
It came from the ancient custom that, when gagaku (traditional court music) was played, "senshuraku," which suggested congratulations, was played as the last number of the day.
sen.cmt: スペースをのぞきました。

sen.j: 能の付祝言において、「高砂 (能)」キリの「千秋楽は民を撫で」以下が謡われることが多かった
sen.e: Or in Tsukeshugen (a short celebratory Noh play) of Noh play, "Stroking people in general in Senshuraku" and the following portion at the end of "Takasago (a Noh play)" was sung frequently.
Or in Tsukeshugen (a short celebratory Noh play) of a Noh play, "Stroking people in general in Senshuraku" and the following portion at the end of "Takasago (a Noh play)" was often sung.
Or in Tsukeshugen (a short celebratory Noh play) of a Noh play, "Stroking people in general in Senshuraku" and the following part at the end of "Takasago (a Noh play)" was often sung.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: いずれにしろ地口の一種であり、雅楽や能の曲目と直接の関係があるわけではない。
sen.e: Any way, either of them is a pun and is not related directly to the numbers of gagaku or Noh.
At any rate, either of them is a pun and is not related directly to the numbers of gagaku or Noh.
At any rate, either of them is a pun and is not related directly to the programs of gagaku or Noh.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 風習
sen.e: Customs
Customs
Customs

sen.j: 興行の中で、初日・中日（なかび）・千秋楽の3日が特に重要な日として考えられており、出演者が互いに楽屋を訪れ挨拶するなどの習慣がある。
sen.e: When plays on the same program are performed for days, the three days of shonichi (the first day), nakabi (the middle day) and senshuraku (the final day) are considered to be the most important ones, and it is customary that the performers visit each other at their respective back-stage rooms on these days.

When plays on the same program are performed for days, the three days of shonichi (the first day), nakabi (the middle day) and senshuraku (the final day) are considered to be the most important ones, and it is customary that the performers visit each other at their respective backstage rooms on these days.

When plays on the same program are performed for days, the three days of shonichi (the first day), nakabi (the middle day) and senshuraku (the final day) are considered to be the most important ones, and it is customary that the performers visit each other at their respective backstage rooms and pay their compliments to each other.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 現在では儀礼が簡略化され、中日の挨拶などは略されることが多いが、初日と千秋楽は重要視されている。
sen.e: Although now these formalities have been simplified, importance is still placed on shonichi and senshuraku.
Although now these formalities have been simplified, importance is still placed on shonichi and senshuraku.
Although these formalities especially nakabi's compliment have been simplified these days, importance is still placed on shonichi and senshuraku.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 歌舞伎や商業演劇のように、一座の座頭や花形役者が明確に決まっている場合、下回りの役者に対して座長が振る舞いをする習慣もある。
sen.e: When, as in Kabuki and commercial theatrical performances, the head of performers or a star performer is definite, it is also customary that the head entertains the lower-ranked performers on the senshuraku day.

When, as in kabuki and commercial theatrical performances, the head performer or a star performer is definite, it is also customary that the head entertains the lower-ranked performers on the senshuraku day.

When the head performer or a star performer is fixed as in kabuki and commercial theatrical performances, it is also customary that the performer entertains the lower-ranked performers on the senshuraku day.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 興行における一座の一体感を確認し、共にひとつの舞台をつくりあげてきたことを喜び合う日として、千秋楽は独自の意味を持っているといえる。
sen.e: Senshuraku has a special meaning as the day when sense of unity should be confirmed among the performers and they all should delight having achieved a play together.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Senshuraku has a special meaning as the day when a sense of unity should be confirmed among the performers, and they all should take delight in having achieved a play together.
Senshuraku has the special meaning as the day when a sense of unity should be confirmed among the performers, and they all take delight in having achieved a play together.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また、商業的な演劇でなくともこの日にいわゆる「打ち上げ」が行われることも多い。
sen.e: "A part celebrating that a run of performances has been completed" is often held on the senshuraku day, even when the performances are not commercial ones.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: "A party celebrating that a run of performances has been completed" is often held on the senshuraku day, even when the performances aren't commercial ones.
A party celebrating that a run of performances has completed is often held on the senshuraku day, even when the performances aren't commercial ones.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 特色
sen.e: Features
Features
Features

sen.j: 千秋楽の日の舞台は歌舞伎などにおいては役者のふざけや冗談が許されるという不文律があり、芝居の流れを壊さない程度で、しゃれやいたずらを用意して共演者をからかうこともある。
sen.e: In kabuki, there exists an unwritten rule that performers can play banters and jokes on stage on the senshuraku day, and they sometimes mock some other performers preparing puns and mischief in advance, in the range that does not hinder the flow of the play.

In kabuki there exists an unwritten rule that performers can banter and joke with one another onstage on the senshuraku day, and they sometimes mock other performers by preparing puns and mischief in advance, but only to the extent that it won't hinder the flow of the play.

In kabuki, there was an unwritten rule that performers can banter and joke with one another onstage on the senshuraku day, and they sometimes mock other performers by preparing puns and mischief in advance, but only to the extent that it won't hinder the flow of the play.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: これをそそりという。
sen.e: This called sosori.
This is called sosori.
This is called sosori.

sen.j: その時限りの台詞や演出の変更があったり、アドリブをきかせたり、サプライズゲストが登場して観客を盛り上げることがある。
sen.e: To excite audiences, something not included in the script is said, the planned play flow is changed, something is said ad lib, and/or an unexpected guest appears on stage.
To excite audiences, something not included in the script is said, the planned flow of the play is changed, something is said ad lib, and/or an unexpected guest will appear onstage.
To excite audiences, something not included in the script is said, the planned flow of the play is changed, ad-lib words are said, and/or an unexpected guest will appear onstage.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また、カーテンコールで俳優が謝辞などを述べることもある。
sen.e: In addition, an actor sometimes expresses thanks to audiences corresponding to a curtain call.
Occasionally, an actor will express thanks to the audiences in response to a curtain call.
Occasionally, an actor will express thanks to the audiences in response to a curtain call.

sen.j: そのため千秋楽の公演は人気があり、他の公演日に先駆けて前売りチケットが売切れになったりする。
sen.e: Therefore, performances on the senshuraku day are favored, and advance tickets are sometimes sold out before those on the other days.
Therefore, performances on the senshuraku day are favored, and advance tickets are sometimes sold out before those on the other days.
Therefore, performances on the senshuraku day are favored, and advance tickets are sometimes sold out before those for the other days.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また、人気公演ではプレミア化することもある。
sen.e: It also sometimes happens that tickets for favored performances on the day are sold at premium prices.
It also sometimes happens that tickets for favored performances on the day are sold at premium prices.
Moreover, sometimes it happens that tickets for favored performances on the day are sold at premium prices.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 大相撲
sen.e: Grand sumo tournaments
Grand sumo tournaments
Grand sumo tournaments

sen.j: 大相撲においては、1909年（明治42年）の両国国技館開館以前は、千秋楽は幕内力士は出場しないしきたりがあった。
sen.e: In the grand sumo tournaments before 1909 when Ryogoku Kokugikan opened, it was customary that no wrestler in the elite makuuchi division appeared in the sumo ring on the senshuraku day.
In the grand sumo tournaments before 1909, when Ryogoku Kokugikan opened, it was customary that no wrestler in the elite Makuuchi division would appear in the sumo ring on the senshuraku day.

In the grand sumo tournaments before 1909, when Ryogoku Kokugikan (National Sumo Stadium) opened, it was customary that no wrestler in the elite Maku-uchi division would appear in the sumo ring on the senshuraku day.

sen.j: また、この日だけは女性が公然と観戦できるというならわしもあった。
sen.e: It was also customary that, on this day alone, females were allowed to view sumo-wrestling matches openly.
It was also customary that, on this day alone, females were allowed to openly view sumo-wrestling matches.
On this day alone, there was a custom that females were allowed to watch sumo-wrestling matches in public.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: ただし、江戸時代の看板大関の場合、千秋楽だけに看板大関同士の取組がくまれることもあった。
sen.e: However, in the Edo period, matches between Kanban Ozeki ("Guest Ozeki", big strong looking local lads who were only brought in to draw local crowds) sumo wresters were sometimes scheduled on the senshuraku day alone.

However, in the Edo period matches between Kanban Ozeki ("guest Ozeki," big strong-looking local lads who were only brought in to draw local crowds) sumo wresters were sometimes scheduled on the senshuraku day alone.

However, during the Edo period, matches between Kanban Ozeki ("guest Ozeki," big strong-looking local lads who were only brought in to draw local crowds) sumo wrestlers were sometimes scheduled on the senshuraku day alone.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: これより三役
sen.e: Koreyori Sanyaku (concerns bouts on the senshuraku day)
Koreyori Sanyaku (concerning bouts on the senshuraku day)
Koreyori Sanyaku (concerning bouts on the senshuraku day)

sen.j: 千秋楽の取組の最後の3番をこう呼ぶ。
sen.e: The final three bouts on the senshuraku day are called "Koreyori Sanyaku."
The final three bouts on the senshuraku day are called "Koreyori Sanyaku."
The final three bouts on the senshuraku day are named lika that.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: この3番に登場する力士は、呼び上げとともに東西各3人が同時にあがり、拍手をうち、四股をふむ。
sen.e: The three sumo wrestlers for these three bouts on the east side and those on the west side appear, corresponding to the announcement of their wrestler names, in the sumo ring at the same time, respectively, clap their hands and stamp in unison in a ceremonious way.

The three sumo wrestlers for these three bouts on the east side and those on the west side would appear, corresponding to the announcement of their wrestler names, in the sumo ring at the same time, clap their hands and stamp in unison in a ceremonious way.

The three sumo wrestlers for these three bouts on the east and the west sides would appear, corresponding to the announcement of their wrestler names, in the sumo ring at the same time, clap their hands and stamp in unison in a ceremonious way.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: この所作を〈三役そろい踏み〉と呼ぶ。
sen.e: These ceremonious actions of these wresters are called "Sanyaku Soroibumi."
These ceremonious actions of the wresters were called "Sanyaku Soroibumi."
These ceremonious actions of the wrestlers were called "Sanyaku Soroibumi."
sen.cmt: wrestler にスペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 最初の取組の勝者には矢、次の取組の勝者には弓弦、結びの勝者には弓が与えられる。
sen.e: An arrow is given to the winner of the first bout, a string to the winner of the second bout and a bow to the winner of the last bout.
An arrow is given to the winner of the first bout, a string to the winner of the second bout and a bow to the winner of the last bout.
An arrow is given to the winner of the first bout, a string to the winner of the second bout and a bow to the winner of the last bout.

sen.j: 現在の弓取式は、これを連日おこなうようになったものである。
sen.e: Today's bow twirling ceremony is the everyday version of this ceremony described above.
Today's bow-twirling ceremony is the everyday version of the above-described ceremony.
Today's bow-twirling ceremony is the everyday version of the above-described ceremony.

sen.j: 行司による勝ち名乗りも、〈役相撲にかなう○○（勝った力士のしこ名）〉というものになる。
sen.e: The announcement of the winner by the sumo referee takes the form of "Yakuzumo ni kanau (the winner of one of the final three bouts) OO (the winner's sumo wrester name).
The announcement of the winner by the sumo referee takes the form of "Yakuzumo ni kanau (the winner of one of the final three bouts) OO (the winner's sumo wrester name).
The announcement of the winner by the sumo referee takes the form of "Yakuzumo ni kanau XX (the name of the winner of the bout)"
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: なお、休場者がでて不戦勝 (相撲)になるときには、取組順を変えて、そろい踏みの前に動かし、必ず3人がそろい踏みをできるようにする。
sen.e: When a sumo wrestler withdraws from a bout and the bout is not executed, with a win given to the opponent, the order of the bouts are changed so that three wrestlers are always available for soroibumi.

When a sumo wrestler withdraws from a bout and the bout isn't executed, whereby a win is given to the opponent, the order of the bouts is changed so that three wrestlers are always available for soroibumi.
When a sumo wrestler is absent and the bout is not fought, whereby a win is given to the opponent, the order of the bouts is changed so that three wrestlers are always available for soroibumi.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 〈これより三役〉への最多登場回数は、武蔵丸光洋の58回、最多勝利は大鵬幸喜の40勝、最多敗戦は千代大海龍二の34敗である。
sen.e: The maximum number of participations in "Koreyori Sanyaku" is 58 by Koyo MUSASHIMARU, the maximum number of wins in "Koreyori Sanyaku" is 40 by Koki TAIHO, and the maximum number of losses in "Koreyori Sanyaku" is 34 by Ryuji CHIYOTAIKAI.

The maximum number of participations in "Koreyori Sanyaku" is 58 by Koyo MUSASHIMARU, the maximum number of wins in "Koreyori Sanyaku" is 40 by Koki TAIHO, and the maximum number of losses in "Koreyori Sanyaku" is 34 by Ryuji CHIYOTAIKAI.

The maximum number of appearances in "Koreyori Sanyaku" is 58 by Koyo MUSASHIMARU, the maximum number of wins in it is 40 by Koki TAIHO, and the maximum number of losses in it is 34 by Ryuji CHIYOTAIKAI.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また、琴富士孝也は、唯一の登場機会であった1991年9月場所、14日目の相撲で負傷し休場、不戦敗となったために、そろい踏みの機会を逸してしまった。
sen.e: Takaya KOTOFUJI had only an opportunity to participate in soroibumi in the September sumo tournament in 1990, but failed to do so because he was damaged in a bout on the 14th day and lost the bout on the next day by default..

Takaya KOTOFUJI had only one opportunity to participate in soroibumi in the September sumo tournament of 1990, but he failed to do so because he was damaged in a bout on the fourteenth day and lost the bout on the next day by default.

Takaya KOTOFUJI had only one opportunity to participate in soroibumi in the September sumo tournament of 1991, but he failed to do so because he was injured in a bout on the fourteenth day and lost the bout on the next day by default.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。
